title: Settling the complexity of Nash equilibrium in congestion games
abstract:
Abstract
We consider (i) the problem of finding a (possibly mixed) Nash equilibrium in congestion games, and (ii) the problem of finding an (exponential precision) fixed point of the gradient descent dynamics of a smooth function f:[0,1]n‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript01ùëõ‚Ñùf:[0,1]^{n}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}.
We prove that these problems are equivalent.
Our result holds for various explicit descriptions of fùëìf, ranging from (almost general) arithmetic circuits, to degree-555 polynomials.
By a very recent result of¬†[FGHS20], this implies that
these problems are \PPAD‚à©\PLS\PPAD\PLS\PPAD\cap\PLS-complete. As a corollary, we also obtain the following equivalence of complexity classes:



\CCLS=\PPAD‚à©\PLS.\CCLS\PPAD\PLS\CCLS=\PPAD\cap\PLS.
